kaleidoscope

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • kaleidoscope.Shape
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ball, Polygon, Rectangle

    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
    The Shape abstract class provides instance variables and methods for determining movement, reflection positions, and setters/getters for instance variables, to be used by subclass shapes.
    Author:
    Ryan Smith, Nicki Hoffman

    • Method Detail

      • initFacets

        public void initFacets()
        Initializes facets variable. For each facets[i], populates facets[i][2] with the facet's width and facets[i][3] with the facet's height.

      • setLimits

        public void setLimits(int xLimit,
             int yLimit)
        Sets the "walls" that the ball should bounce off from.
        Parameters:
        xLimit - The position (in pixels) of the wall on the right.
        yLimit - The position (in pixels) of the floor.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns:
        The Shape's X position.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns:
        The Shape's Y position.

      • makeOneStep

        public void makeOneStep()
        Tells the ball to advance one step in the direction that it is moving. If it hits a wall, its direction of movement changes.

      • flip

        public int flip(int value,
       int size,
       int limit)
        Returns:
        A coordinate of the ball reflected across a vertical or horizontal axis.

      • mirror

        public int mirror(int value,
         int limit1,
         int limit2)
        Returns:
        A coordinate of the ball reflected across a diagonal axis.

      • makeFacets

        public void makeFacets()
        Computes & stores the x, y coordinates of each of the object's reflections (including the original) in facets; facets[i][0] = x, facets[i][1] = y.

      • getFacets

        public int[][] getFacets()
        Returns:
        int[][] facets - an array each of whose elements is an array representing one of Shape's reflections as {x, y, width, height}.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns:
        Shape's width

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Sets Shape's width.
        Parameters:
        width - - New width for Shape (integer)

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns:
        Shape's height

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(int height)
        Sets Shape's height.
        Parameters:
        height - - New height for Shape.

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Returns:
        Shape's color as Color object.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the Shape's color.
        Parameters:
        color - to set

      • getxDelta

        public int getxDelta()
        Returns:
        Current speed in x direction.

      • setxDelta

        public void setxDelta(int xDelta)
        Sets the x-direction speed.
        Parameters:
        xDelta - - integer speed to set for x direction.

      • getyDelta

        public int getyDelta()
        Returns:
        Current speed in y direction.

      • setyDelta

        public void setyDelta(int yDelta)
        Sets the y-direction speed.
        Parameters:
        yDelta - - integer speed to set for y direction.
